hero.title: Simple, Scenic Tours from Port Elizabeth
hero.description: Uncluttered itineraries, honest pricing, and small-group day trips across the Eastern Cape and Garden Route.

valueProps.title: Local Expertise
valueProps.description: Gqeberha-based guides who know the quiet lookouts, best hours for wildlife, and weather patterns.

valueProps.title: Small Groups
valueProps.description: Max 8 guests per vehicle for a calm pace and more time on the sights you came for.

valueProps.title: Straightforward Pricing
valueProps.description: No hidden fees—just clear inclusions and rounded ZAR prices.

features.title: Flexible Pickup
features.description: Hotel, airport, or beachfront. We confirm pickup windows 24 hours before departure.

features.title: Eco-conscious
features.description: Partner lodges and suppliers that prioritize conservation and community.

features.title: Secure Payments
features.description: Card or EFT with instant confirmations and printable invoices.

tours.title: Addo Elephant Park Day Safari
tours.description: A relaxed, full-day game drive focused on elephant herds and classic Eastern Cape wildlife.

tours.title: Tsitsikamma Suspension Bridges & Forest Walk
tours.description: A gentle day in Tsitsikamma National Park: forest boardwalks, sea spray, and the famous suspension bridges.

tours.title: Sardinia Bay Sunset Stroll
tours.description: An easy evening outing to watch the sun drop into the Indian Ocean from sheltered dunes.

tours.title: Garden Route Taster (2 Days)
tours.description: A calm sampler of the Garden Route with one overnight in Knysna and scenic stops along the coast.

tours.title: Graaff-Reinet & Valley of Desolation
tours.description: A big-sky day out: historic streets, fossil-rich landscapes, and golden afternoon light over the Karoo.

tours.title: Jeffreys Bay Coast & Craft
tours.description: Coastal viewpoints and local makers in South Africa’s surf capital—easy pace and scenic drives.

tours.title: Baviaanskloof Pass & Picnic
tours.description: A rugged yet unrushed day along the Baviaanskloof passes—views, river bends, and quiet backroads.
